conclusion: Analyze forces acting on latch and conditions for self-locking.
Identify spring force, normal force, and frictional force acting on latch D.
Frictional force is F_f = mu F_N.
Component of spring force perpendicular to inclined surface is F_s cos theta.
Normal force F_N acts perpendicular to inclined surface.
For equilibrium in perpendicular direction, F_N = F_s cos theta.
Component of spring force parallel to inclined surface is F_s sin theta.
Frictional force F_f acts parallel to inclined surface.
For equilibrium in parallel direction, F_s sin theta = F_f.
Substitute F_f = mu F_N to get F_s sin theta = mu F_N.
Substitute F_N from perpendicular direction equation: F_s sin theta = mu (F_s cos theta).
Simplify to get tan theta = mu.
Self-locking occurs when tan theta <= mu.
Calculate normal force F_N: F_N = F_s cos theta.
Substitute F_s = kx to get F_N = kx cos theta.
Final answer: magnitude of normal force is F_N = kx cos theta.
